definitions: Used with an auxiliary verb or ‘be’ to form the negative.
Used in some constructions with other verbs.
Used as a short substitute for a negative clause.
Used to express the negative of other words.
Used with a quantifier to exclude a person or part of a group.
No more than (used to indicate a surprisingly small quantity)
Used in understatements to suggest that the opposite of a following word or phrase is true.
Following and emphatically negating a statement.
